page.title: 07TOURISM IN CHIPPERFIELD
page.content: Across the road from Pale Farm & the Old Forge and facing the common is the Two Brewers Hotel,a successful small member of a large international chain. The 16th century building incorporates former shop,ale house & schoolmaster's house. A traditional English dinner costs Â£10.50. Accommodation with twin beds, shower, T.V.& kettle costs Â£35. There is also a simpler, self-service buffet lunch served in the lounge or very popular public bar. Many visitors relax & enjoy the rural atmosphere of the common,by drinking, picnicking, watching cricket or walking in the woods. An annual event, attracting visitors in July,is a group meeting of Morris Men who camp in the village & dance outside the 4 public houses, (namely: The Two Brewers, The Boot, The Windmill & The Royal Oak).
